docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Health of Brooklyn met yesterday at the usual hour. Nuisances in vacant lots in Carroll-street near Van Brunt, gutters in Sands, Washington and Adams-street, were reported by the Health Wardens, and the same were directed to be abated.
docs.snippet: The Board of Health of Brooklyn met yesterday at the usual hour. Nuisances in vacant lots in Carroll-street near Van Brunt, gutters in Sands, Washington and Adams-street, were reported by the Health Wardens, and the same were directed to be abated.

docs.lead_paragraph: An early dissolution of the present British Ministry appears more than probable.- It may not be unprofitable, on the near prospect of a change, to examine the personality of the existing rulers of England, and of their probable successors.
docs.snippet: An early dissolution of the present British Ministry appears more than probable.- It may not be unprofitable, on the near prospect of a change, to examine the personality of the existing rulers of England, and of their probable successors.

headline.main: Daily Reports Wanted from the Board of Health.

docs.lead_paragraph: It cannot be denied that a deal of wisdom lies ensconsed in our excellent Board of Health. They are not going to kick up a dust and drive people out of town, and keep strangers from stopping at our hotels and buying our broadcloths--not they. So

docs.lead_paragraph: By James Bower Harrison. The effect of habitual opium taking on health and longevity, has been a subject of legal consideration. A remarkable trial took place in relation to some assuranees effected by the late Earl of MAR in the Edinburg Life Assurance Company.

docs.lead_paragraph: WHAT A LOCAL BOARD OF HEATH CAN DO.--Through the efforts, during six months, of the local Board of Health for the parochial district of Regent-square Church, St. Pancras, 639 separate sources of infection have been or are about to be abolished, by the removal of cess-pools, the renewal of drains, the trapping of sinks, and the removal of refuse.

headline.main: COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS.; Board of Aldermen

docs.lead_paragraph: NATHAN C. ELY, Esq., President, in the Chair. PETITIONS. By Alderman W. TUCKER -- Petition of persons doing business in and about Clinton Market, for alterations to said Market. To Committee on Markets. By the President -- Petition of Jeremiah Johnson, Driver of Hack No. 204, to be renumerated for damages. To the Board of Councilmen.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN.--Yesterday morning, eleven cases of cholera were reported to the Board of Health, two of which resulted in death. In a communication to the Board of Health, the Health Officer Says:

docs.lead_paragraph: COFFEE IS DETHRONED.--"LIEBIG, (the illustrious German chemist.) says that asparagus contains, in common with ten and coffee, a principle which be calls 'taurine.' and which he considers essential to the health of those who do not take strong exercise.

docs.lead_paragraph: From Sunday morning to Saturday night, through the whole of last week, New-York was like an oven. The sun poured down his hottest rays. intercepted by scarcely a cloud, from' his rising till his setting. The pavements flashed back the heat like mirrors of brass. rses sunk
